customer_reviews.text: I think the pictures speak for themselves. Very cheap product. The center melted. It just came right off. Go for a dewalt or bosch instead. Much better quality and longevity.

customer_reviews.title: The torque selector is recessed into drill body and cannot be easily rotated. The speed selector on the top requires ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not typical Makita quality. Why? The torque selector is recessed into drill body and cannot be easily rotated. The speed selector on the top requires using screwdriver to pry into position. Generally, controls are very rigid and need force to switch. It's made out of hard plastic that does not feel "right" to touch, not like green or white and black Makitas. I also wasn't aware they make production in China. On a positive side, it has copious amounts of torque and is very light and super small, great for overhead and tight space work. Very strong LED illuminating work ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good drill driver for 'round the house.
customer_reviews.text: Great overall compact drill driver. The chuck easily ratchets onto smooth-shanked bits, and holds very well. Motor is torquey enough to drive 6" decking screws into pine without breaking a sweat. Battery is a 2.0Ahr unit, and it very good for most jobs around the house. My only complaint is there's only one battery, but that would drive up the cost. Is it a bulky bruiser for drilling 5/8th holes in hardened steel all day? Nope. It does great for majority of household jobs, but it's not a main-line drill for commercial or industrial jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D, Smith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad one (XFD11ZB) and should have returned it. I was hoping to replace the "white" Makita (LXFD01) with this one since it is well worn. But, I find that I reach for the "white" instead of this one.

product_meta.title: Makita XFD11ZB 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Sub-Compact Brushless Cordless 1/2" Driver Drill
product_meta.description: Style:Bare ToolDo more with less. The Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion sub-compact Brushless cordless driver-drill (model XFD11ZB, tool only, battery sold separately) is an ultra-compact drilling and driving solution with significantly less weight. The 18V sub-compact driver-drill is part of a new class of compact, with the size and weight of lower voltage tools but with the performance, power and compatibility of 18-Volt. The expansive breadth-of-line of the Makita 18V LXT® Series means an 18V battery from any LXT tool will power the 18V sub-compact driver-drill. The XFD11ZB has an efficient Brushless motor with two speed settings and dual L.E.D. Lights to illuminate the work area. At only 6-3/8 in. And 2.8 lbs. (With battery, sold separately) it is an ultra-compact drilling and driving solution with superior comfort and handling. It's part of Makita’s expanding 18V Lithium-Ion Series, the world’s largest cordless tool line-up powered by 18V Lithium-Ion slide-style batteries. Makita 18V Lithium-Ion batteries have the fastest charge times in their categories, so they spend more time working and less time sitting on the charger.
feature_bullets: Compact and ergonomic design at only 6-3/8" long
Weighs only 2.8 lbs. With battery (battery not included) for reduced operator fatigue
Ideal for working in tight spaces
Mechanical variable 2-speed transmission (0-500 & 0-1,700 RPM) for a wide range of drilling and driving applications
Dual L.E.D. Lights illuminate the work area
